messages.author: xhwang
messages.text: This list is is intermediate result and we have to combine it with container type, key_system, security level etc to create a KeySystemInfo list. So I'd keep it concise and short. How about dropping |container_type| here and handles containers in a higher level (e.g. in MediaSourcePlayer)?

messages.author: qinmin
messages.text:
On 2013/09/11 21:01:23, xhwang wrote:
> This list is is intermediate result and we have to combine it with container
> type, key_system, security level etc to create a KeySystemInfo list. So I'd keep
> it concise and short. How about dropping |container_type| here and handles
> containers in a higher level (e.g. in MediaSourcePlayer)?

Done.

messages.author: xhwang
messages.text: Container and codec should be relatively orthogonal. Nothing prevents people from putting vp8 into a .mp4 container. This list is fine for our use cases, but I really think we should not have anything related to container in MediaCodec* classes. Maybe move this conversion to MediaSourcePlayer?

messages.author: qinmin
messages.text:
Just to be consistent with the function name above. Changed both function names to AndroidMimeType.

On 2013/09/11 21:01:23, xhwang wrote:
> s/MimeType/AndroidCodecType or AndroidMimeType

messages.author: qinmin
messages.text:
Removed this conversion, will have this map in a separate cl when I hook up with the key_system_info

On 2013/09/11 21:01:23, xhwang wrote:
> Container and codec should be relatively orthogonal. Nothing prevents people
> from putting vp8 into a .mp4 container. This list is fine for our use cases, but
> I really think we should not have anything related to container in MediaCodec*
> classes. Maybe move this conversion to MediaSourcePlayer?
